data.chText: 人
data.enText: people

data.chText: 把…介绍（给）；引见；（自我）介绍
data.enText: to tell two or more people who have not met before what each other's names are; to tell sb what your name is

data.chText: 我来介绍一下我的妻子。
data.enText: Can I introduce my wife?

data.chText: 他在聚会上介绍我认识了一位希腊姑娘。
data.enText: He introduced me to a Greek girl at the party.

data.chText: 我们已经介绍认识了。
data.enText: We've already been introduced.

data.chText: 让我来自我介绍一下吧。我叫海伦∙罗宾斯。
data.enText: Can I introduce myself? I'm Helen Robins.

data.chText: “凯，这是史蒂夫。”“是的，我知道——我们已经自己相互介绍了。”
data.enText: ‘Kay, this is Steve.’ ‘Yes, I know─we've already introduced ourselves.’

data.chText: 电视 / 电台节目
data.enText: TV/radio show

data.chText: 主持（节目）；介绍（讲演者或演员）
data.enText: to be the main speaker in a television or radio show, who gives details about the show and who presents the people who are in it; to tell the audience the name of the person who is going to speak or perform

data.chText: 下一个节目由玛丽∙戴维主持。
data.enText: The next programme will be introduced by Mary David.

data.chText: 请让我介绍一下今晚节目的第一位嘉宾…
data.enText: May I introduce my first guest on the show tonight…

data.chText: 新经历
data.enText: new experience

data.chText: 使初次了解；使尝试
data.enText: to make sb learn about sth or do sth for the first time

data.chText: 第一堂课是让学生了解这门课的主要内容。
data.enText: The first lecture introduces students to the main topics of the course.

data.chText: 是她最先使我体会到了帆船运动的乐趣。
data.enText: It was she who first introduced the pleasures of sailing to me.

data.chText: 新产品 / 法律
data.enText: new product/law

data.chText: 推行；实施；采用
data.enText: to make sth available for use, discussion, etc. for the first time

data.chText: 公司今年将推出一系列新产品。
data.enText: The company is introducing a new range of products this year.

data.chText: 这项新法律是于1991年开始实施的。
data.enText: The new law was introduced in 1991.

data.chText: 我们想向各学校推介最新的技术。
data.enText: We want to introduce the latest technology into schools.

data.chText: 动植物；疾病
data.enText: plant/animal/disease

data.chText: 引进（动物或植物）；传入（疾病）
data.enText: to bring a plant, an animal or a disease to a place for the first time

data.chText: 自从引进山羊之后，这个岛上的植被模式改变了。
data.enText: Vegetation patterns changed when goats were introduced to the island.

data.chText: 开始
data.enText: start

data.chText: 作为（新事物）的开头；使开始；创始
data.enText: to be the start of sth new

data.chText: 伦敦的乐队引发了对这种音乐的狂热。
data.enText: Bands from London introduced the craze for this kind of music.

data.chText: 缓慢的主旋律引出了第一乐章。
data.enText: A slow theme introduces the first movement.

data.chText: 议会
data.enText: in parliament

data.chText: 将（法案）提交讨论
data.enText: to formally present a new law so that it can be discussed

data.chText: （向议会）提交议案
data.enText: to introduce a bill (before Parliament)

data.chText: 增加
data.enText: add

data.chText: 将…放进；添入
data.enText: to put sth into sth

data.chText: 这种婴儿食品中被掺进了玻璃碎屑。
data.enText: Particles of glass had been introduced into the baby food.

simple_means.memory_skill: intro 进入 + duc 引导；带来 + e → 介绍；引入

example: The fall of the Berlin Wall ushered in the post-Cold War period

tr: cause to come to know personally
example: permit me to acquaint you with my son
introduce the new neighbors to the community

tr: furnish with a preface or introduction
example: She always precedes her lectures with a joke
He prefaced his lecture with a critical remark about the institution

tr: bring before the public for the first time, as of an actor, song, etc.

example: insert a picture into the text

tr: bring in or establish in a new place or environment
bring something new to an environment
example: A new word processor was introduced

tr: bring in a new person or object into a familiar environment
example: He brought in a new judge
The new secretary introduced a nasty rumor

value.def: To introduce something means to cause it to enter a place or exist in a system for the first time.

example.ex: The Government has introduced a number of other money-saving moves...
example.tran: 政府已经采取了其他一些省钱的举措。

example.ex: I kept the birds indoors all winter and introduced them into an aviary the following June...
example.tran: 整个冬天我把鸟关在室内,然后在接下来的6月份把它们放入鸟类饲养场饲养。

example.ex: The word 'Pagoda' was introduced to Europe by the 17th century Portuguese.
example.tran: Pagoda 这个词由 17 世纪的葡萄牙人引入欧洲。

example.ex: He is best remembered for the introduction of the moving assembly-line.
example.tran: 他最为人铭记的创举是率先采用流水装配线。

example.ex: ...the introduction of a privacy bill to prevent press intrusions into private lives.
example.tran: 实施隐私法以阻止新闻媒体对私人生活的侵扰

value.def: If you introduce someone to something, you cause them to learn about it or experience it for the first time.

example.ex: He introduced us to the delights of natural food.
example.tran: 他让我们认识到食用天然食物的乐趣。

value.tran: 介绍;使了解;使初次接触

example.ex: His introduction to League football would have been gentler if he had started at a smaller club...
example.tran: 如果他是在小点的俱乐部起步的话,他的首次足球联赛经历可能会更轻松些。

example.ex: It was Sergeant Miller's introduction to a crime which has occupied him for nearly nine years.
example.tran: 米勒巡佐从未用这么久的时间处理一宗罪案,它已花了他将近9年的时间。

value.def: If you introduce one person to another, or you introduce two people, you tell them each other's names, so that they can get to know each other. If you introduce yourself to someone, you tell them your name.

example.ex: Tim, may I introduce you to my uncle's secretary, Mary Waller?...
example.tran: 蒂姆,我来介绍一下，这位是我叔叔的秘书玛丽·沃勒。

example.ex: Someone introduced us and I sat next to him...
example.tran: 有人给我们作了介绍,我挨着他坐下了。

example.ex: We haven't been introduced. My name is Nero Wolfe...
example.tran: 还没人介绍我们。我叫尼罗·沃尔夫。

example.ex: With considerable shyness, Elaine performed the introductions.
example.tran: 伊莱恩非常害羞地进行了介绍。

value.def: The person who introduces a television or radio programme speaks at the beginning of it, and often between the different items in it, in order to explain what the programme or the items are about.

example.ex: 'Health Matters' is introduced by Dick Oliver on BBC World Service.
example.tran: 英国广播公司对外广播频道的“健康动态”节目由迪克·奥利弗主持。

value.tran: 为(电视或广播节目)做开场白;主持

trans: 介绍我自己；自我介绍；做自我介绍；介绍自己；自我介绍一下吧
介绍你自己；自我介绍；介绍一下自己；简短的自我介绍；介绍自己

rootsaffixes.indicate: = to lead, to bring 引导；带来
rootsaffixes.title: duc, duct

partsOfSpeech.dec: ab 离开 + duct 引导；带来 → 引开 → 诱拐
aque〔= aqua 水〕+ duct 引导；带来 → 导水管
con 共同 + duct 引导；带来 → 引导共同做 → 指挥
de 向下 + duc 引导；带来 + e → 向下引出 → 推论
deduce的名词

partsOfSpeech.d: 管，导管（用于引导传送物品）

partsOfSpeech.dec: duct 引导；带来 + ile 易…的 → 易引导的 → 可塑的
e 加强 + duc 引导；带来 + ate 做，造成，使… → 不断引导 → 教育
e 出 + duc 引导；带来 + e → 引出，引起
educe的名词
in 进入 + duc 引导；带来 + e → 引进去 → 诱导
in 加以… + duct 引导；带来 → 引导；传授
intro 进入 + duc 引导；带来 + e → 介绍；引入
pro 向前 + duce 引导；带来 → 向前产出 → 生产
pro 向前 + duct 引导；带来 → 向前产出的东西 → 产品
pro 向前 + duc 引导；带来 + tive …的 → 生产的；多产的
pro 向前 + duc 引导；带来 + tivity → 生产力；生产活动
re 回 + duc 引导；带来 + e → 引回 → 减少
se 离开 + duc 引导；带来 + e → 引导…离开 → 勾引
seduce的名词
venti〔= vent 风〕+ duct 引导；带来 → 通风道
via 道路 + duct 引导；带来 → 引导〔汽车通行〕的道路 → 高架桥
intro 向内，入内 + duc 引导 + e → 引入
intro 向内，入内 + duc 引导 + tion → 介绍；引进
intro 向内，入内 + flect 弯曲 + ion 表状态 → 向内弯曲
intro 向内，入内 + mit 送 → 送进去 → 插入
intro 向内，入内 + spect 看 → 向内看 → 内省
intro 向内，入内 + vers〔 = vert转〕+ ible 可…的 → 可向内翻的
intro 向内，入内 + vert 转 → 向内转 → 内向
